summary.long: Deuteronomy is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: This is what Moses said to all of Israel in the Transjordanian wilderness, the arid rift valley opposite Suph, between Paran and Tophel, Laban, Hazeroth, and Di Zahab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it is ordinarily an eleven-day journey from Horeb to Kadesh Barnea by way of Mount Seir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, it was not until the first day of the eleventh month of the fortieth year that Moses addressed the Israelites just as the Lord had instructed him to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This took place after the defeat of King Sihon of the Amorites, whose capital was in Heshbon, and King Og of Bashan, whose capital was in Ashtaroth, specifically in Edrei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it was in the Transjordan, in Moab, that Moses began to deliver these words:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord our God spoke to us at Horeb and said, “You have stayed in the area of this mountain long enough.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Head out and resume your journey. Enter the Amorite hill country, and all its neighboring areas, including the rift valley, the hill country, the foothills, the Negev, and the coastal plain—all of Canaan and Lebanon as far as the Great River, that is, the Euphrates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look! I have already given the land to you. Go, occupy the territory that I, the Lord, promised to give to your ancestors Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, and to their descendants.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I also said to you at that time, “I am no longer able to sustain you by myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God has increased your population to the point that you are now as numerous as the very stars of the sky.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, may the Lord, the God of your ancestors, make you a thousand times more numerous than you are now, blessing you just as he said he would!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But how can I alone bear up under the burden of your hardship and strife?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Select wise and practical men, those known among your tribes, whom I may appoint as your leaders.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You replied to me that what I had said to you was good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I chose as your tribal leaders wise and well-known men, placing them over you as administrators of groups of thousands, hundreds, fifties, and tens, and also as other tribal officials.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I furthermore admonished your judges at that time that they should pay attention to issues among your fellow citizens and judge fairly, whether between one person and a native Israelite or a resident foreigner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They must not discriminate in judgment, but hear the lowly and the great alike. Nor should they be intimidated by human beings, for judgment belongs to God. If the matter being adjudicated is too difficult for them, they should bring it before me for a hearing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I instructed you at that time regarding everything you should do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then we left Horeb and passed through all that immense, forbidding wilderness that you saw on the way to the Amorite hill country as the Lord our God had commanded us to do, finally arriving at Kadesh Barnea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said to you, “You have come to the Amorite hill country, which the Lord our God is about to give us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look, he has placed the land in front of you! Go up, take possession of it, just as the Lord, the God of your ancestors, said to do. Do not be afraid or discouraged!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all of you approached me and said, “Let’s send some men ahead of us to scout out the land and bring us back word as to how we should attack it and what the cities are like there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I thought this was a good idea, so I sent twelve men from among you, one from each tribe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left and went up to the hill country, coming to the Eshcol Valley, which they scouted out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they took some of the produce of the land and carried it back down to us. They also brought a report to us, saying, “The land that the Lord our God is about to give us is good.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You were not willing to go up, however, but instead rebelled against the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You complained among yourselves privately and said, “Because the Lord hates us he brought us from Egypt to deliver us over to the Amorites so they could destroy us!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What is going to happen to us? Our brothers have drained away our courage by describing people who are more numerous and taller than we are, and great cities whose defenses appear to be as high as heaven itself! Moreover, they said they saw Anakites there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I responded to you, “Do not be terrified of them!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God is about to go ahead of you; he will fight for you, just as you saw him do in Egypt
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in the wilderness, where you saw him carrying you along like a man carries his son. This he did everywhere you went until you came to this very place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, through all this you did not have confidence in the Lord your God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who would go before you on the way to find places for you to camp, appearing in a fire at night and in a cloud by day to show you the way you ought to go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Lord heard you, he became angry and made this vow:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Not a single person of this evil generation will see the good land that I promised to give to your ancestors!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The exception is Caleb son of Jephunneh; he will see it and I will give him and his descendants the territory on which he has walked, because he has wholeheartedly followed me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for me, the Lord was also angry with me on your account. He said, “You also will not be able to go there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, Joshua son of Nun, your assistant, will go. Encourage him, because he will enable Israel to inherit the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also, your infants, who you thought would die on the way, and your children, who as yet do not know good from bad, will go there; I will give them the land and they will possess it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for you, turn back and head for the wilderness by the way to the Red Sea.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you responded to me and admitted, “We have sinned against the Lord. We will now go up and fight as the Lord our God has told us to do.” So you each put on your battle gear and prepared to go up to the hill country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord told me: “Tell them this: ‘Do not go up and fight, because I will not be with you and you will be defeated by your enemies.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I spoke to you, but you did not listen. Instead you rebelled against the Lord and recklessly went up to the hill country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Amorite inhabitants of that area confronted you and chased you like a swarm of bees, striking you down from Seir as far as Hormah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you came back and wept before the Lord, but he paid no attention to you whatsoever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, you remained at Kadesh for a long time—indeed, for the full time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then we turned and set out toward the wilderness on the way to the Red Sea just as the Lord told me to do, detouring around Mount Seir for a long time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At this point the Lord said to me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You have circled around this mountain long enough; now turn north.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instruct these people as follows: ‘You are about to cross the border of your relatives the descendants of Esau, who inhabit Seir. They will be afraid of you, so watch yourselves carefully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not be hostile toward them, because I am not giving you any of their land, not even a footprint, for I have given Mount Seir as an inheritance for Esau.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may purchase food to eat and water to drink from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All along the way I, the Lord your God, have blessed your every effort. I have been attentive to your travels through this great wilderness. These forty years I have been with you; you have lacked nothing.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So we turned away from our relatives the descendants of Esau, the inhabitants of Seir, turning from the route of the rift valley which comes up from Elat and Ezion Geber, and traveling the way of the wilderness of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me, “Do not harass Moab and provoke them to war, for I will not give you any of their land as your territory. This is because I have given Ar to the descendants of Lot as their possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (The Emites used to live there, a people as powerful, numerous, and tall as the Anakites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These people, as well as the Anakites, are also considered Rephaites; the Moabites call them Emites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Previously the Horites lived in Seir, but the descendants of Esau dispossessed and destroyed them and settled in their place, just as Israel did to the land it came to possess, the land the Lord gave them.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, get up and cross the Wadi Zered.” So we did so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the length of time it took for us to go from Kadesh Barnea to the crossing of Wadi Zered was thirty-eight years, time for all the military men of that generation to die, just as the Lord had vowed to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, it was the very hand of the Lord that eliminated them from within the camp until they were all gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it was that after all the military men had been eliminated from the community,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Lord said to me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Today you are going to cross the border of Moab, that is, of Ar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when you come close to the Ammonites, do not harass or provoke them because I am not giving you any of the Ammonites’ land as your possession; I have already given it to Lot’s descendants as their possession.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (That also is considered to be a land of the Rephaites. The Rephaites lived there originally; the Ammonites call them Zamzummites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are a people as powerful, numerous, and tall as the Anakites. But the Lord destroyed the Rephaites in advance of the Ammonites, so they dispossessed them and settled down in their place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is exactly what he did for the descendants of Esau who lived in Seir when he destroyed the Horites before them so that they could dispossess them and settle in their area to this very day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the Avvites who lived in settlements as far west as Gaza, Caphtorites who came from Crete destroyed them and settled down in their place.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Get up, make your way across Wadi Arnon. Look, I have already delivered over to you Sihon the Amorite, king of Heshbon, and his land. Go ahead—take it! Engage him in war!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This very day I will begin to fill all the people of the earth with dread and to terrify them when they hear about you. They will shiver and shake in anticipation of your approach.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I sent messengers from the Kedemoth wilderness to King Sihon of Heshbon with an offer of peace:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let me pass through your land; I will keep strictly to the roadway. I will not turn aside to the right or the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sell me food for cash so that I can eat and sell me water to drink. Just allow me to go through on foot,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as the descendants of Esau who live at Seir and the Moabites who live in Ar did for me, until I cross the Jordan to the land the Lord our God is giving us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But King Sihon of Heshbon was unwilling to allow us to pass near him because the Lord our God had made him obstinate and stubborn so that he might deliver him over to you this very day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to me, “Look! I have already begun to give over Sihon and his land to you. Start right now to take his land as your possession.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Sihon and all his troops emerged to encounter us in battle at Jahaz,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Lord our God delivered him over to us and we struck him down, along with his sons and everyone else.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time we seized all his cities and put every one of them under divine judgment, including even the women and children; we left no survivors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We kept only the livestock and plunder from the cities for ourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Aroer, which is at the edge of Wadi Arnon (it is the city in the wadi), all the way to Gilead there was not a town able to resist us—the Lord our God gave them all to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, you did not approach the land of the Ammonites, the Wadi Jabbok, the cities of the hill country, or any place else forbidden by the Lord our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Next we set out on the route to Bashan, but King Og of Bashan and his whole army came out to meet us in battle at Edrei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord, however, said to me, “Don’t be afraid of him because I have already given him, his whole army, and his land to you. You will do to him exactly what you did to King Sihon of the Amorites who lived in Heshbon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord our God did indeed give over to us King Og of Bashan and his whole army, and we struck them down until not a single survivor was left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We captured all his cities at that time—there was not a town we did not take from them—sixty cities, all the region of Argob, the dominion of Og in Bashan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of these cities were fortified by high walls, gates, and locking bars; in addition there were a great many open villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We put all of these under divine judgment just as we had done to King Sihon of Heshbon—every occupied city, including women and children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all the livestock and plunder from the cities we kept for ourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So at that time we took the land of the two Amorite kings in the Transjordan from Wadi Arnon to Mount Hermon
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (the Sidonians call Hermon Sirion and the Amorites call it Senir),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the cities of the plateau, all of Gilead and Bashan as far as Salecah and Edrei, cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only King Og of Bashan was left of the remaining Rephaites. (It is noteworthy that his sarcophagus was made of iron. Does it not, indeed, still remain in Rabbath of the Ammonites? It is 13½ feet long and 6 feet wide according to standard measure.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the land we brought under our control at that time: The territory extending from Aroer by the Wadi Arnon and half the Gilead hill country with its cities I gave to the Reubenites and Gadites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rest of Gilead and all of Bashan, the kingdom of Og, I gave to half the tribe of Manasseh. (All the region of Argob, that is, all Bashan, is called the land of Rephaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jair, son of Manasseh, took all the Argob region as far as the border with the Geshurites and Maacathites—namely Bashan—and called it by his name, Havvoth Jair, which it retains to this very day.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I gave Gilead to Machir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the Reubenites and Gadites I allocated the territory extending from Gilead as far as Wadi Arnon (the exact middle of the wadi was a boundary) all the way to the Wadi Jabbok, the Ammonite border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rift valley and the Jordan River were also a border, from the Sea of Kinnereth to the sea of the rift valley (that is, the Salt Sea), beneath the slopes of Pisgah to the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time I instructed you as follows: “The Lord your God has given you this land for your possession. You warriors are to cross over equipped for battle before your fellow Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But your wives, children, and livestock (of which I know you have many) may remain in the cities I have given you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must fight until the Lord gives your countrymen victory as he did you and they take possession of the land that the Lord your God is giving them on the other side of the Jordan River. Then each of you may return to his own territory that I have given you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I also commanded Joshua at the same time, “You have seen everything the Lord your God did to these two kings; he will do the same to all the kingdoms where you are going.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not be afraid of them, for the Lord your God will personally fight for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, at that time I pleaded with the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “O, Sovereign Lord, you have begun to show me your greatness and strength. (What god in heaven or earth can rival your works and mighty deeds?)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let me please cross over to see the good land on the other side of the Jordan River—this good hill country and the Lebanon!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord was angry at me because of you and would not listen to me. Instead, he said to me, “Enough of that! Do not speak to me anymore about this matter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go up to the top of Pisgah and take a good look to the west, north, south, and east, for you will not be allowed to cross the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Commission Joshua, and encourage and strengthen him, because he will lead these people over and will enable them to inherit the land you will see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So we settled down in the valley opposite Beth Peor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, Israel, pay attention to the statutes and ordinances I am about to teach you, so that you might live and go on to enter and take possession of the land that the Lord, the God of your ancestors, is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not add a thing to what I command you nor subtract from it, so that you may keep the commandments of the Lord your God that I am delivering to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have witnessed what the Lord did at Baal Peor, how he eradicated from your midst everyone who followed Baal Peor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you who remained faithful to the Lord your God are still alive to this very day, every one of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look! I have taught you statutes and ordinances just as the Lord my God told me to do, so that you might carry them out in the land you are about to enter and possess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So be sure to do them, because this will testify of your wise understanding to the people who will learn of all these statutes and say, “Indeed, this great nation is a very wise people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, what other great nation has a god so near to them like the Lord our God whenever we call on him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And what other great nation has statutes and ordinances as just as this whole law that I am about to share with you today?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, however, pay very careful attention, lest you forget the things you have seen and disregard them for the rest of your life; instead teach them to your children and grandchildren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You stood before the Lord your God at Horeb and he said to me, “Assemble the people before me so that I can tell them my commands. Then they will learn to revere me all the days they live in the land, and they will instruct their children.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You approached and stood at the foot of the mountain, a mountain ablaze to the sky above it and yet dark with a thick cloud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to you from the middle of the fire; you heard speech but you could not see anything—only a voice was heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he revealed to you the covenant he has commanded you to keep, the Ten Commandments, writing them on two stone tablets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, at that same time the Lord commanded me to teach you statutes and ordinances for you to keep in the land that you are about to enter and possess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be very careful, then, because you saw no form at the time the Lord spoke to you at Horeb from the middle of the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say this so you will not corrupt yourselves by making an image in the form of any kind of figure. This includes the likeness of a human male or female,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: any kind of land animal, any bird that flies in the sky,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: anything that crawls on the ground, or any fish in the deep waters under the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you look up to the sky and see the sun, moon, and stars—the whole heavenly creation—you must not be seduced to worship and serve them, for the Lord your God has assigned them to all the people of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You, however, the Lord has selected and brought from Egypt, that iron-smelting furnace, to be his special people as you are today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord became angry with me because of you and vowed that I would never cross the Jordan nor enter the good land that he is about to give you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I must die here in this land; I will not cross the Jordan. But you are going over and will possess that good land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be on guard so that you do not forget the covenant of the Lord your God that he has made with you, and that you do not make an image of any kind, just as he has forbidden you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord your God is a consuming fire; he is a jealous God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After you have produced children and grandchildren and have been in the land a long time, if you become corrupt and make an image of any kind and do other evil things before the Lord your God that enrage him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I invoke heaven and earth as witnesses against you today that you will surely and swiftly be removed from the very land you are about to cross the Jordan to possess. You will not last long there because you will surely be annihilated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord will scatter you among the peoples and there will be very few of you among the nations where the Lord will drive you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There you will worship gods made by human hands—wood and stone that can neither see, hear, eat, nor smell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you seek the Lord your God from there, you will find him, if, indeed, you seek him with all your heart and soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In your distress when all these things happen to you in future days, if you return to the Lord your God and obey him
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (for he is a merciful God), he will not let you down or destroy you, for he cannot forget the covenant with your ancestors that he confirmed by oath to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, ask about the distant past, starting from the day God created humankind on the earth, and ask from one end of heaven to the other, whether there has ever been such a great thing as this, or even a rumor of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have a people ever heard the voice of God speaking from the middle of fire, as you yourselves have, and lived to tell about it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or has God ever before tried to deliver a nation from the middle of another nation, accompanied by judgments, signs, wonders, war, strength, power, and other very terrifying things like the Lord your God did for you in Egypt before your very eyes?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have been taught that the Lord alone is God—there is no other besides him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From heaven he spoke to you in order to teach you, and on earth he showed you his great fire from which you also heard his words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, because he loved your ancestors, he chose their descendants who followed them and personally brought you out of Egypt with his great power
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to dispossess nations greater and stronger than you and brought you here this day to give you their land as your property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Today realize and carefully consider that the Lord is God in heaven above and on earth below—there is no other!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep his statutes and commandments that I am setting forth today so that it may go well with you and your descendants and that you may enjoy longevity in the land that the Lord your God is about to give you as a permanent possession.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses selected three cities in the Transjordan, toward the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who accidentally killed someone without hating him at the time of the accident could flee to one of those cities and be safe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These cities are Bezer, in the wilderness plateau, for the Reubenites; Ramoth in Gilead for the Gadites; and Golan in Bashan for the Manassehites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the law that Moses set before the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the stipulations, statutes, and ordinances that Moses spoke to the Israelites after he had brought them out of Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the Transjordan, in the valley opposite Beth Peor, in the land of King Sihon of the Amorites, who lived in Heshbon. (It is he whom Moses and the Israelites attacked after they came out of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They possessed his land and that of King Og of Bashan—both of whom were Amorite kings in the Transjordan, to the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their territory extended from Aroer at the edge of the Arnon valley as far as Mount Siyon—that is, Hermon—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: including all the rift valley of the Transjordan in the east to the sea of the rift valley, beneath the slopes of Pisgah.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses called all the people of Israel together and said to them: “Listen, Israel, to the statutes and ordinances that I am about to deliver to you today; learn them and be careful to keep them!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord our God made a covenant with us at Horeb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did not make this covenant with our ancestors but with us, we who are here today, all of us living now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke face to face with you at the mountain, from the middle of the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (I was standing between the Lord and you at that time to reveal the Lord’s message to you, because you were afraid of the fire and would not go up the mountain.) He said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the Lord your God—he who brought you from the land of Egypt, from the place of slavery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You must not have any other gods besides me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You must not make for yourself an image of anything in heaven above, on earth below, or in the waters beneath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not worship or serve them, for I, the Lord your God, am a jealous God. I punish the sons, grandsons, and great-grandsons for the sin of the fathers who reject me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but I show covenant faithfulness to the thousands who choose me and keep my commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You must not make use of the name of the Lord your God for worthless purposes, for the Lord will not exonerate anyone who abuses his name that way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Be careful to observe the Sabbath day just as the Lord your God has commanded you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to work and do all your tasks in six days,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the seventh day is the Sabbath of the Lord your God. On that day you must not do any work, you, your son, your daughter, your male slave, your female slave, your ox, your donkey, any other animal, or the resident foreigner who lives with you, so that your male and female slaves, like yourself, may have rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Recall that you were slaves in the land of Egypt and that the Lord your God brought you out of there by strength and power. That is why the Lord your God has commanded you to observe the Sabbath day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Honor your father and your mother just as the Lord your God has commanded you to do, so that your days may be extended and that it may go well with you in the land that he is about to give you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You must not murder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You must not commit adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You must not steal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You must not offer false testimony against another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not desire another man’s wife, nor should you crave his house, his field, his male and female servants, his ox, his donkey, or anything else he owns.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said these things to your entire assembly at the mountain from the middle of the fire, the cloud, and the darkness with a loud voice, and that was all he said. Then he inscribed the words on two stone tablets and gave them to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, when you heard the voice from the midst of the darkness while the mountain was ablaze, all your tribal leaders and elders approached me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You said, “The Lord our God has shown us his great glory, and we have heard him speak from the middle of the fire. It is now clear to us that God can speak to human beings and they can keep on living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now, why should we die, because this intense fire will consume us? If we keep hearing the voice of the Lord our God we will die!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who is there from the entire human race who has heard the voice of the living God speaking from the middle of the fire as we have, and has lived?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You go near so that you can hear everything the Lord our God is saying and then you can tell us whatever he says to you; then we will pay attention and do it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Lord heard you speaking to me, he said to me, “I have heard what these people have said to you—they have spoken well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If only it would really be their desire to fear me and obey all my commandments in the future, so that it may go well with them and their descendants forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go and tell them, ‘Return to your tents!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for you, remain here with me so I can declare to you all the commandments, statutes, and ordinances that you are to teach them, so that they can carry them out in the land I am about to give them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be careful, therefore, to do exactly what the Lord your God has commanded you; do not turn right or left!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Walk just as he has commanded you so that you may live, that it may go well with you, and that you may live long in the land you are going to possess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the commandments, statutes, and ordinances that the Lord your God instructed me to teach you so that you may carry them out in the land where you are headed
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that you may so revere the Lord your God that you will keep all his statutes and commandments that I am giving you—you, your children, and your grandchildren—all your lives, to prolong your days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pay attention, Israel, and be careful to do this so that it may go well with you and that you may increase greatly in number—as the Lord, the God of your ancestors, said to you, you will have a land flowing with milk and honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear, O Israel: The Lord is our God, the Lord is one!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must love the Lord your God with your whole mind, your whole being, and all your strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These words I am commanding you today must be kept in mind,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you must teach them to your children and speak of them as you sit in your house, as you walk along the road, as you lie down, and as you get up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You should tie them as a reminder on your forearm and fasten them as symbols on your forehead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Inscribe them on the doorframes of your houses and gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then when the Lord your God brings you to the land he promised your ancestors Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob to give you—a land with large, fine cities you did not build,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: houses filled with choice things you did not accumulate, hewn-out cisterns you did not dig, and vineyards and olive groves you did not plant—and you eat your fill,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: be careful not to forget the Lord who brought you out of Egypt, that place of slavery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must revere the Lord your God, serve him, and take oaths using only his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not go after other gods, those of the surrounding peoples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the Lord your God, who is present among you, is a jealous God—his anger will erupt against you and remove you from the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not put the Lord your God to the test as you did at Massah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep his commandments very carefully, as well as the stipulations and statutes he commanded you to observe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do whatever is proper and good before the Lord so that it may go well with you and that you may enter and occupy the good land that he promised your ancestors,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that you may drive out all your enemies just as the Lord said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When your children ask you later on, “What are the stipulations, statutes, and ordinances that the Lord our God commanded you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you must say to them, “We were Pharaoh’s slaves in Egypt, but the Lord brought us out of Egypt in a powerful way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he brought signs and great, devastating wonders on Egypt, on Pharaoh, and on his whole family before our very eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He delivered us from there so that he could give us the land he had promised our ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord commanded us to obey all these statutes and to revere him so that it may always go well for us and he may preserve us, as he has to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We will be innocent if we carefully keep all these commandments before the Lord our God, just as he demands.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Lord your God brings you to the land that you are going to occupy and forces out many nations before you—Hittites, Girgashites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites, seven nations more numerous and powerful than you—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he delivers them over to you and you attack them, you must utterly annihilate them. Make no treaty with them and show them no mercy!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not intermarry with them. Do not give your daughters to their sons or take their daughters for your sons,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for they will turn your sons away from me to worship other gods. Then the anger of the Lord will erupt against you and he will quickly destroy you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, this is what you must do to them: You must tear down their altars, shatter their sacred pillars, cut down their sacred Asherah poles, and burn up their idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you are a people holy to the Lord your God. He has chosen you to be his people, prized above all others on the face of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is not because you were more numerous than all the other peoples that the Lord favored and chose you—for in fact you were the least numerous of all peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rather it is because of his love for you and his faithfulness to the promise he solemnly vowed to your ancestors that the Lord brought you out with great power, redeeming you from the place of slavery, from the power of Pharaoh king of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So realize that the Lord your God is the true God, the faithful God who keeps covenant faithfully with those who love him and keep his commandments, to a thousand generations,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but who pays back those who hate him as they deserve and destroys them. He will not ignore those who hate him but will repay them as they deserve!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So keep the commandments, statutes, and ordinances that I today am commanding you to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you obey these ordinances and are careful to do them, the Lord your God will faithfully keep covenant with you as he promised your ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will love and bless you, and make you numerous. He will bless you with many children, with the produce of your soil, your grain, your new wine, your olive oil, the offspring of your oxen, and the young of your flocks in the land that he promised your ancestors to give you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be blessed beyond all peoples; there will be no barrenness among you or your livestock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will protect you from all sickness, and you will not experience any of the terrible diseases that you knew in Egypt; instead he will inflict them on all those who hate you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must destroy all the people whom the Lord your God is about to deliver over to you; you must not pity them or worship their gods, for that will be a snare to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you think, “These nations are more numerous than I—how can I dispossess them?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you must not fear them. You must carefully recall what the Lord your God did to Pharaoh and all Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the great judgments you saw, the signs and wonders, the strength and power by which he brought you out—thus the Lord your God will do to all the people you fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, the Lord your God will release hornets among them until the very last ones who hide from you perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not tremble in their presence, for the Lord your God, who is present among you, is a great and awesome God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He, the God who leads you, will expel the nations little by little. You will not be allowed to destroy them all at once lest the wild animals overrun you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God will give them over to you; he will throw them into a great panic until they are destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will hand over their kings to you, and you will erase their very names from memory. Nobody will be able to resist you until you destroy them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must burn the images of their gods, but do not covet the silver and gold that covers them so much that you take it for yourself and thus become ensnared by it; for it is abhorrent to the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not bring any abhorrent thing into your house and thereby become an object of divine wrath along with it. You must absolutely detest and abhor it, for it is an object of divine wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must keep carefully all these commandments I am giving you today so that you may live, increase in number, and go in and occupy the land that the Lord promised to your ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember the whole way by which he has brought you these forty years through the wilderness so that he might, by humbling you, test you to see if you have it within you to keep his commandments or not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he humbled you by making you hungry and then feeding you with unfamiliar manna. He did this to teach you that humankind cannot live by bread alone, but also by everything that comes from the Lord’s mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your clothing did not wear out nor did your feet swell all these forty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be keenly aware that just as a parent disciplines his child, so the Lord your God disciplines you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you must keep his commandments, live according to his standards, and revere him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord your God is bringing you to a good land, a land of brooks, springs, and fountains flowing forth in valleys and hills,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a land of wheat, barley, vines, fig trees, and pomegranates, of olive trees and honey,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a land where you may eat food in plenty and find no lack of anything, a land whose stones are iron and from whose hills you can mine copper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will eat your fill and then praise the Lord your God because of the good land he has given you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be sure you do not forget the Lord your God by not keeping his commandments, ordinances, and statutes that I am giving you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you eat your fill, when you build and occupy good houses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when your cattle and flocks increase, when you have plenty of silver and gold, and when you have abundance of everything,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: be sure you do not feel self-important and forget the Lord your God who brought you from the land of Egypt, the place of slavery,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and who brought you through the great, fearful wilderness of venomous serpents and scorpions, an arid place with no water. He made water flow from a flint rock and
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: fed you in the wilderness with manna (which your ancestors had never before known) so that he might by humbling you test you and eventually bring good to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be careful not to say, “My own ability and skill have gotten me this wealth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must remember the Lord your God, for he is the one who gives ability to get wealth; if you do this he will confirm his covenant that he made by oath to your ancestors, even as he has to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if you forget the Lord your God at all and follow other gods, worshiping and prostrating yourselves before them, I testify to you today that you will surely be annihilated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just like the nations the Lord is about to destroy from your sight, so he will do to you because you would not obey him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen, Israel: Today you are about to cross the Jordan so you can dispossess the nations there, people greater and stronger than you who live in large cities with extremely high fortifications.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They include the Anakites, a numerous and tall people whom you know about and of whom it is said, “Who is able to resist the Anakites?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Understand today that the Lord your God who goes before you is a devouring fire; he will defeat and subdue them before you. You will dispossess and destroy them quickly just as he has told you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not think to yourself after the Lord your God has driven them out before you, “Because of my own righteousness the Lord has brought me here to possess this land.” It is because of the wickedness of these nations that the Lord is driving them out ahead of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is not because of your righteousness, or even your inner uprightness, that you have come here to possess their land. Instead, because of the wickedness of these nations, the Lord your God is driving them out ahead of you in order to confirm the promise he made on oath to your ancestors, to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Understand, therefore, that it is not because of your righteousness that the Lord your God is about to give you this good land as a possession, for you are a stubborn people!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember—don’t ever forget—how you provoked the Lord your God in the wilderness; from the time you left the land of Egypt until you came to this place you were constantly rebelling against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At Horeb you provoked him and he was angry enough with you to destroy you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I went up the mountain to receive the stone tablets, the tablets of the covenant that the Lord made with you, I remained there forty days and nights, eating and drinking nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord gave me the two stone tablets, written by the very finger of God, and on them was everything he said to you at the mountain from the midst of the fire at the time of that assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now at the end of the forty days and nights the Lord presented me with the two stone tablets, the tablets of the covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to me, “Get up, go down at once from here because your people whom you brought out of Egypt have sinned! They have quickly turned from the way I commanded them and have made for themselves a cast metal image.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, he said to me, “I have taken note of these people; they are a stubborn lot!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stand aside and I will destroy them, obliterating their very name from memory, and I will make you into a stronger and more numerous nation than they are.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I turned and went down the mountain while it was blazing with fire; the two tablets of the covenant were in my hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I looked, you had indeed sinned against the Lord your God and had cast for yourselves a metal calf; you had quickly turned aside from the way he had commanded you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I grabbed the two tablets, threw them down, and shattered them before your very eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I again fell down before the Lord for forty days and nights; I ate and drank nothing because of all the sin you had committed, doing such evil before the Lord as to enrage him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I was terrified at the Lord’s intense anger that threatened to destroy you. But he listened to me this time as well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord was also angry enough at Aaron to kill him, but at that time I prayed for him too.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for your sinful thing that you had made, the calf, I took it, melted it down, ground it up until it was as fine as dust, and tossed the dust into the stream that flows down the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, you continued to provoke the Lord at Taberah, Massah, and Kibroth Hattaavah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he sent you from Kadesh Barnea and told you, “Go up and possess the land I have given you,” you rebelled against the Lord your God and would neither believe nor obey him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have been rebelling against him from the very first day I knew you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I lay flat on the ground before the Lord for forty days and nights, for he had said he would destroy you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I prayed to him: O, Sovereign Lord, do not destroy your people, your valued property that you have powerfully redeemed, whom you brought out of Egypt by your strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember your servants Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob; ignore the stubbornness, wickedness, and sin of these people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Otherwise the people of the land from which you brought us will say, “The Lord was unable to bring them to the land he promised them, and because of his hatred for them he has brought them out to kill them in the wilderness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are your people, your valued property, whom you brought out with great strength and power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that same time the Lord said to me, “Carve out for yourself two stone tablets like the first ones and come up the mountain to me; also make for yourself a wooden ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will write on the tablets the same words that were on the first tablets you broke, and you must put them into the ark.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I made an ark of acacia wood and carved out two stone tablets just like the first ones. Then I went up the mountain with the two tablets in my hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord then wrote on the tablets the same words, the Ten Commandments, which he had spoken to you at the mountain from the middle of the fire at the time of that assembly, and he gave them to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I turned, went down the mountain, and placed the tablets into the ark I had made—they are still there, just as the Lord commanded me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: During those days the Israelites traveled from Beeroth Bene Jaakan to Moserah. There Aaron died and was buried, and his son Eleazar became priest in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there they traveled to Gudgodah, and from Gudgodah to Jotbathah, a place of flowing streams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time the Lord set apart the tribe of Levi to carry the ark of the Lord’s covenant, to stand before the Lord to serve him, and to formulate blessings in his name, as they do to this very day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Levi has no allotment or inheritance among his brothers; the Lord is his inheritance just as the Lord your God told him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for me, I stayed at the mountain as I did the first time, forty days and nights. The Lord listened to me that time as well and decided not to destroy you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to me, “Get up, set out leading the people so they may go and possess the land I promised to give to their ancestors.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, Israel, what does the Lord your God require of you except to revere him, to obey all his commandments, to love him, to serve him with all your mind and being,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to keep the Lord’s commandments and statutes that I am giving you today for your own good?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The heavens—indeed the highest heavens—belong to the Lord your God, as does the earth and everything in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, only to your ancestors did he show his loving favor, and he chose you, their descendants, from all peoples—as is apparent today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, cleanse your hearts and stop being so stubborn!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord your God is God of gods and Lord of lords, the great, mighty, and awesome God who is unbiased and takes no bribe,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who justly treats the orphan and widow, and who loves resident foreigners, giving them food and clothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you must love the resident foreigner because you were foreigners in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Revere the Lord your God, serve him, be loyal to him, and take oaths only in his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is the one you should praise; he is your God, the one who has done these great and awesome things for you that you have seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When your ancestors went down to Egypt, they numbered only seventy, but now the Lord your God has made you as numerous as the stars of the sky.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must love the Lord your God and do what he requires; keep his statutes, ordinances, and commandments at all times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bear in mind today that I am not speaking to your children who have not personally experienced the judgments of the Lord your God, which revealed his greatness, strength, and power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did not see the awesome deeds he performed in the midst of Egypt against Pharaoh king of Egypt and his whole land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or what he did to the army of Egypt, including their horses and chariots, when he made the waters of the Red Sea overwhelm them while they were pursuing you and he annihilated them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did not see what he did to you in the wilderness before you reached this place,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or what he did to Dathan and Abiram, sons of Eliab the Reubenite, when the earth opened its mouth in the middle of the Israelite camp and swallowed them, their families, their tents, and all the property they brought with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am speaking to you because you are the ones who saw with your own eyes all the great deeds of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now pay attention to all the commandments I am giving you today, so that you may be strong enough to enter and possess the land where you are headed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that you may enjoy long life in the land the Lord promised to give to your ancestors and their descendants, a land flowing with milk and honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the land where you are headed is not like the land of Egypt from which you came, a land where you planted seed and which you irrigated by hand like a vegetable garden.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, the land you are crossing the Jordan to occupy is one of hills and valleys, a land that drinks in water from the rains,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a land the Lord your God looks after. He is constantly attentive to it from the beginning to the end of the year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, if you pay close attention to my commandments that I am giving you today and love the Lord your God and serve him with all your mind and being,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then he promises, “I will send rain for your land in its season, the autumn and the spring rains, so that you may gather in your grain, new wine, and olive oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will provide pasture for your livestock and you will eat your fill.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make sure you do not turn away to serve and worship other gods!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the anger of the Lord will erupt against you, and he will close up the sky so that it does not rain. The land will not yield its produce, and you will soon be removed from the good land that the Lord is about to give you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fix these words of mine into your mind and being, tie them as a reminder on your hands, and let them be symbols on your forehead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Teach them to your children and speak of them as you sit in your house, as you walk along the road, as you lie down, and as you get up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Inscribe them on the doorframes of your houses and on your gates
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that your days and those of your descendants may be extended in the land that the Lord promised to give to your ancestors, like the days of heaven itself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if you carefully observe all of these commandments I am giving you and love the Lord your God, live according to his standards, and remain loyal to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then he will drive out all these nations ahead of you, and you will dispossess nations greater and stronger than you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every place you set your foot will be yours; your border will extend from the desert to Lebanon and from the River (that is, the Euphrates) as far as the Mediterranean Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nobody will be able to resist you; the Lord your God will spread the fear and terror of you over the whole land on which you walk, just as he promised you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take note—I am setting before you today a blessing and a curse:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the blessing if you take to heart the commandments of the Lord your God that I am giving you today,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the curse if you pay no attention to his commandments and turn from the way I am setting before you today to pursue other gods you have not known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Lord your God brings you into the land you are to possess, you must pronounce the blessing on Mount Gerizim and the curse on Mount Ebal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are they not across the Jordan River, toward the west, in the land of the Canaanites who live in the rift valley opposite Gilgal near the oak of Moreh?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you are about to cross the Jordan to possess the land the Lord your God is giving you, and you will possess and inhabit it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be certain to keep all the statutes and ordinances that I am presenting to you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the statutes and ordinances you must be careful to obey as long as you live in the land the Lord, the God of your ancestors, has given you to possess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must by all means destroy all the places where the nations you are about to dispossess worship their gods—on the high mountains and hills and under every leafy tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must tear down their altars, shatter their sacred pillars, burn up their sacred Asherah poles, and cut down the images of their gods; you must eliminate their very memory from that place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not worship the Lord your God the way they worship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you must seek only the place he chooses from all your tribes to establish his name as his place of residence, and you must go there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there you must take your burnt offerings, your sacrifices, your tithes, the personal offerings you have prepared, your votive offerings, your freewill offerings, and the firstborn of your herds and flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Both you and your families must feast there before the Lord your God and rejoice in all the output of your labor with which he has blessed you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not do as we are doing here today, with everyone doing what seems best to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for you have not yet come to the final stop and inheritance the Lord your God is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you do go across the Jordan River and settle in the land he is granting you as an inheritance and you find relief from all the enemies who surround you, you will live in safety.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you must come to the place the Lord your God chooses for his name to reside, bringing everything I am commanding you—your burnt offerings, sacrifices, tithes, the personal offerings you have prepared, and all your choice votive offerings that you devote to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall rejoice in the presence of the Lord your God, along with your sons, daughters, male and female servants, and the Levites in your villages (since they have no allotment or inheritance with you).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make sure you do not offer burnt offerings in any place you wish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for you may do so only in the place the Lord chooses in one of your tribal areas—there you may do everything I am commanding you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the other hand, you may slaughter and eat meat as you please when the Lord your God blesses you in all your villages. Both the ritually pure and impure may eat it, whether it is a gazelle or an ibex.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, you must not eat blood—pour it out on the ground like water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will not be allowed to eat in your villages your tithe of grain, new wine, olive oil, the firstborn of your herd and flock, any votive offerings you have vowed, or your freewill and personal offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only in the presence of the Lord your God may you eat these, in the place he chooses. This applies to you, your son, your daughter, your male and female servants, and the Levites in your villages. In that place you will rejoice before the Lord your God in all the output of your labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be careful not to overlook the Levites as long as you live in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Lord your God extends your borders as he said he would do and you say, “I want to eat meat just as I please,” you may do so as you wish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the place he chooses to locate his name is too far for you, you may slaughter any of your herd and flock he has given you just as I have stipulated; you may eat them in your villages just as you wish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As you eat the gazelle or ibex, so you may eat these; the ritually impure and pure alike may eat them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, by no means eat the blood, for the blood is life itself—you must not eat the life with the meat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not eat it! You must pour it out on the ground like water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not eat it so that it may go well with you and your children after you; you will be doing what is right in the Lord’s sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the holy things and votive offerings that belong to you, you must pick up and take to the place the Lord will choose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must offer your burnt offerings, both meat and blood, on the altar of the Lord your God; the blood of your other sacrifices you must pour out on his altar while you eat the meat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pay careful attention to all these things I am commanding you so that it may always go well with you and your children after you when you do what is good and right in the sight of the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Lord your God eliminates the nations from the place where you are headed and you dispossess them, you will settle down in their land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they have been destroyed from your presence, be careful not to be ensnared like they are; do not pursue their gods and say, “How do these nations serve their gods? I will do the same.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not worship the Lord your God the way they do! For everything that is abhorrent to him, everything he hates, they have done when worshiping their gods. They even burn up their sons and daughters before their gods!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (13:1) You must be careful to do everything I am commanding you. Do not add to it or subtract from it!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suppose a prophet or one who foretells by dreams should appear among you and show you a sign or wonder,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sign or wonder should come to pass concerning what he said to you, namely, “Let us follow other gods”—gods whom you have not previously known—“and let us serve them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not listen to the words of that prophet or dreamer, for the Lord your God will be testing you to see if you love him with all your mind and being.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must follow the Lord your God and revere only him; and you must observe his commandments, obey him, serve him, and remain loyal to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for that prophet or dreamer, he must be executed because he encouraged rebellion against the Lord your God who brought you from the land of Egypt, redeeming you from that place of slavery, and because he has tried to entice you from the way the Lord your God has commanded you to go. In this way you must purge evil from among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suppose your own full brother, your son, your daughter, your beloved wife, or your closest friend should seduce you secretly and encourage you to go and serve other gods that neither you nor your ancestors have previously known,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the gods of the surrounding people (whether near you or far from you, from one end of the earth to the other).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not give in to him or even listen to him; do not feel sympathy for him or spare him or cover up for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, you must kill him without fail! Your own hand must be the first to strike him, and then the hands of the whole community.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must stone him to death because he tried to entice you away from the Lord your God, who delivered you from the land of Egypt, that place of slavery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus all Israel will hear and be afraid; no longer will they continue to do evil like this among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suppose you should hear in one of your cities, which the Lord your God is giving you as a place to live, that
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: some evil people have departed from among you to entice the inhabitants of their cities, saying, “Let’s go and serve other gods” (whom you have not known before).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must investigate thoroughly and inquire carefully. If it is indeed true that such a disgraceful thing is being done among you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you must by all means slaughter the inhabitants of that city with the sword; annihilate with the sword everyone in it, as well as the livestock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must gather all of its plunder into the middle of the plaza and burn the city and all its plunder as a whole burnt offering to the Lord your God. It will be an abandoned ruin forever—it must never be rebuilt again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not take for yourself anything that has been placed under judgment. Then the Lord will relent from his intense anger, show you compassion, have mercy on you, and multiply you as he promised your ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus you must obey the Lord your God, keeping all his commandments that I am giving you today and doing what is right before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are children of the Lord your God. Do not cut yourselves or shave your forehead bald for the sake of the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you are a people holy to the Lord your God. He has chosen you to be his people, prized above all others on the face of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not eat any forbidden thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the animals you may eat: the ox, the sheep, the goat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the ibex, the gazelle, the deer, the wild goat, the antelope, the wild oryx, and the mountain sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may eat any animal that has hooves divided into two parts and that chews the cud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, you may not eat the following animals among those that chew the cud or those that have divided hooves: the camel, the hare, and the rock badger. (Although they chew the cud, they do not have divided hooves and are therefore ritually impure to you.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also, the pig is ritually impure to you; though it has divided hooves, it does not chew the cud. You may not eat their meat or even touch their remains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These you may eat from among water creatures: anything with fins and scales you may eat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but whatever does not have fins and scales you may not eat; it is ritually impure to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All ritually clean birds you may eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the ones you may not eat: the eagle, the vulture, the black vulture,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the kite, the black kite, the dayyah after its species,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: every raven after its species,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the ostrich, the owl, the seagull, the falcon after its species,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the little owl, the long-eared owl, the white owl,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the jackdaw, the carrion vulture, the cormorant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the stork, the heron after its species, the hoopoe, and the bat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And any swarming winged thing is impure to you—they may not be eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may eat any winged creature that is clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may not eat any corpse, though you may give it to the resident foreigner who is living in your villages and he may eat it, or you may sell it to a foreigner. You are a people holy to the Lord your God. Do not boil a young goat in its mother’s milk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must be certain to tithe all the produce of your seed that comes from the field year after year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the presence of the Lord your God, in the place he chooses to locate his name, you must eat from the tithe of your grain, your new wine, your olive oil, and the firstborn of your herds and flocks, so that you may learn to revere the Lord your God always.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he blesses you, if the place where he chooses to locate his name is distant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you may convert the tithe into money, secure the money, and travel to the place the Lord your God chooses for himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you may spend the money however you wish for cattle, sheep, wine, beer, or whatever you desire. You and your household may eat there in the presence of the Lord your God and enjoy it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the Levites in your villages, you must not ignore them, for they have no allotment or inheritance along with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the end of every three years you must bring all the tithe of your produce, in that very year, and you must store it up in your villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Levites (because they have no allotment or inheritance with you), the resident foreigners, the orphans, and the widows of your villages may come and eat their fill so that the Lord your God may bless you in all the work you do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the end of every seven years you must declare a cancellation of debts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the nature of the cancellation: Every creditor must remit what he has loaned to another person; he must not force payment from his fellow Israelite, for it is to be recognized as “the Lord’s cancellation of debts.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may exact payment from a foreigner, but whatever your fellow Israelite owes you, you must remit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, there should not be any poor among you, for the Lord will surely bless you in the land that he is giving you as an inheritance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if you carefully obey him by keeping all these commandments that I am giving you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord your God will bless you just as he has promised; you will lend to many nations but will not borrow from any, and you will rule over many nations but they will not rule over you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a fellow Israelite from one of your villages in the land that the Lord your God is giving you should be poor, you must not harden your heart or be insensitive to his impoverished condition.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, you must be sure to open your hand to him and generously lend him whatever he needs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be careful lest you entertain the wicked thought that the seventh year, the year of cancellation of debts, has almost arrived, and your attitude be wrong toward your impoverished fellow Israelite and you do not lend him anything; he will cry out to the Lord against you, and you will be regarded as having sinned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must by all means lend to him and not be upset by doing it, for because of this the Lord your God will bless you in all your work and in everything you attempt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There will never cease to be some poor people in the land; therefore, I am commanding you to make sure you open your hand to your fellow Israelites who are needy and poor in your land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your fellow Hebrew—whether male or female—is sold to you and serves you for six years, then in the seventh year you must let that servant go free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you set them free, you must not send them away empty-handed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must supply them generously from your flock, your threshing floor, and your winepress—as the Lord your God has blessed you, you must give to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt and the Lord your God redeemed you; therefore, I am commanding you to do this thing today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, if the servant says to you, “I do not want to leave you,” because he loves you and your household, since he is well off with you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you shall take an awl and pierce a hole through his ear to the door. Then he will become your servant permanently (this applies to your female servant as well).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You should not consider it difficult to let him go free, for he will have served you for six years, twice the time of a hired worker; the Lord your God will bless you in everything you do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must set apart for the Lord your God every firstborn male born to your herds and flocks. You must not work the firstborn of your bulls or shear the firstborn of your flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You and your household must eat them annually before the Lord your God in the place he chooses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If one of them has any kind of blemish—lameness, blindness, or anything else—you may not offer it as a sacrifice to the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may eat it in your villages, whether you are ritually impure or clean, just as you would eat a gazelle or an ibex.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, you must not eat its blood; you must pour it out on the ground like water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Observe the month Abib and keep the Passover to the Lord your God, for in that month he brought you out of Egypt by night.
verses.speaker: Narrator
