verses.text: You must sacrifice the Passover animal (from the flock or the herd) to the Lord your God in the place where he chooses to locate his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not eat any yeast with it; for seven days you must eat bread made without yeast, as symbolic of affliction, for you came out of Egypt hurriedly. You must do this so you will remember for the rest of your lives the day you came out of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There must not be a scrap of yeast within your land for seven days, nor can any of the meat you sacrifice on the evening of the first day remain until the next morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may not sacrifice the Passover in just any of your villages that the Lord your God is giving you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but you must sacrifice it in the evening in the place where he chooses to locate his name, at sunset, the time of day you came out of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must cook and eat it in the place the Lord your God chooses; you may return the next morning to your tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must eat bread made without yeast for six days. The seventh day you are to hold an assembly for the Lord your God; you must not do any work on that day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must count seven weeks; you must begin to count them from the time you begin to harvest the standing grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you are to celebrate the Feast of Weeks before the Lord your God with the voluntary offering that you will bring, in proportion to how he has blessed you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall rejoice before him—you, your son, your daughter, your male and female slaves, the Levites in your villages, the resident foreigners, the orphans, and the widows among you—in the place where the Lord chooses to locate his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, remember that you were a slave in Egypt, and so be careful to observe these statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must celebrate the Feast of Shelters for seven days, at the time of the grain and grape harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to rejoice in your festival, you, your son, your daughter, your male and female slaves, the Levites, the resident foreigners, the orphans, and the widows who are in your villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to celebrate the festival seven days before the Lord your God in the place he chooses, for he will bless you in all your productivity and in whatever you do; so you will indeed rejoice!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three times a year all your males must appear before the Lord your God in the place he chooses for the Feast of Unleavened Bread, the Feast of Weeks, and the Feast of Shelters; and they must not appear before him empty-handed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every one of you must give as you are able, according to the blessing of the Lord your God that he has given you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must appoint judges and civil servants for each tribe in all your villages that the Lord your God is giving you, and they must judge the people fairly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not pervert justice or show favor. Do not take a bribe, for bribes blind the eyes of the wise and distort the words of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must pursue justice alone so that you may live and inherit the land the Lord your God is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not plant any kind of tree as a sacred Asherah pole near the altar of the Lord your God which you build for yourself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not erect a sacred pillar, a thing the Lord your God detests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not sacrifice to him a bull or sheep that has a blemish or any other defect, because that is considered offensive to the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suppose a man or woman is discovered among you in one of your villages that the Lord your God is giving you who sins before the Lord your God and breaks his covenant
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by serving other gods and worshiping them—the sun, moon, or any other heavenly bodies that I have not permitted you to worship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it is reported to you and you hear about it, you must investigate carefully. If it is indeed true that such a disgraceful thing is being done in Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you must bring to your city gates that man or woman who has done this wicked thing—that very man or woman—and you must stone that person to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the testimony of two or three witnesses the person must be executed. They cannot be put to death on the testimony of only one witness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The witnesses must be first to begin the execution, and then all the people are to join in afterward. In this way you will purge the evil from among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a matter is too difficult for you to judge—bloodshed, legal claim, or assault—matters of controversy in your villages—you must leave there and go up to the place the Lord your God chooses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will go to the Levitical priests and the judge in office in those days and seek a solution; they will render a verdict.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must then do as they have determined at that place the Lord chooses. Be careful to do just as you are taught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must do what you are instructed, and the verdict they pronounce to you, without fail. Do not deviate right or left from what they tell you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person who pays no attention to the priest currently serving the Lord your God there, or to the judge—that person must die, so that you may purge evil from Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the people will hear and be afraid, and not be so presumptuous again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you come to the land the Lord your God is giving you and take it over and live in it and then say, “I will select a king like all the nations surrounding me,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you must select without fail a king whom the Lord your God chooses. From among your fellow citizens you must appoint a king—you may not designate a foreigner who is not one of your fellow Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, he must not accumulate horses for himself or allow the people to return to Egypt to do so, for the Lord has said you must never again return that way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, he must not marry many wives lest his affections turn aside, and he must not accumulate much silver and gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he sits on his royal throne he must make a copy of this law on a scroll given to him by the Levitical priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It must be with him constantly, and he must read it as long as he lives, so that he may learn to revere the Lord his God and observe all the words of this law and these statutes and carry them out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he will not exalt himself above his fellow citizens or turn from the commandments to the right or left, and he and his descendants will enjoy many years ruling over his kingdom in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Levitical priests—indeed, the entire tribe of Levi—will have no allotment or inheritance with Israel; they may eat the burnt offerings of the Lord and of his inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will have no inheritance in the midst of their fellow Israelites; the Lord alone is their inheritance, just as he had told them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This shall be the priests’ fair allotment from the people who offer sacrifices, whether bull or sheep—they must give to the priest the shoulder, the jowls, and the stomach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must give them the best of your grain, new wine, and olive oil, as well as the best of your wool when you shear your flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord your God has chosen them and their sons from all your tribes to stand and serve in his name permanently.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suppose a Levite comes by his own free will from one of your villages, from any part of Israel where he is living, to the place the Lord chooses
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and serves in the name of the Lord his God like his fellow Levites who stand there before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He must eat the same share they do, despite any profits he may gain from the sale of his family’s inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you enter the land the Lord your God is giving you, you must not learn the abhorrent practices of those nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There must never be found among you anyone who sacrifices his son or daughter in the fire, anyone who practices divination, an omen reader, a soothsayer, a sorcerer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one who casts spells, one who conjures up spirits, a practitioner of the occult, or a necromancer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever does these things is abhorrent to the Lord, and because of these detestable things the Lord your God is about to drive them out from before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must be blameless before the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those nations that you are about to dispossess listen to omen readers and diviners, but the Lord your God has not given you permission to do such things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God will raise up for you a prophet like me from among you—from your fellow Israelites; you must listen to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This accords with what happened at Horeb in the day of the assembly. You asked the Lord your God: “Please do not make us hear the voice of the Lord our God anymore or see this great fire anymore lest we die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord then said to me, “What they have said is good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will raise up a prophet like you for them from among their fellow Israelites. I will put my words in his mouth and he will speak to them whatever I command.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will personally hold responsible anyone who then pays no attention to the words that prophet speaks in my name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But if any prophet presumes to speak anything in my name that I have not authorized him to speak, or speaks in the name of other gods, that prophet must die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if you say to yourselves, ‘How can we tell that a message is not from the Lord?’—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whenever a prophet speaks in my name and the prediction is not fulfilled, then I have not spoken it; the prophet has presumed to speak it, so you need not fear him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Lord your God destroys the nations whose land he is about to give you and you dispossess them and settle in their cities and houses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you must set apart for yourselves three cities in the middle of your land that the Lord your God is giving you as a possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall build a roadway and divide into thirds the whole extent of your land that the Lord your God is providing as your inheritance; anyone who kills another person should flee to the closest of these cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this is the law pertaining to one who flees there in order to live, if he has accidentally killed another without hating him at the time of the accident.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suppose he goes with someone else to the forest to cut wood and when he raises the ax to cut the tree, the ax head flies loose from the handle and strikes his fellow worker so hard that he dies. The person responsible may then flee to one of these cities to save himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Otherwise the blood avenger will chase after the killer in the heat of his anger, eventually overtake him, and kill him, though this is not a capital case since he did not hate him at the time of the accident.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, I am commanding you to set apart for yourselves three cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the Lord your God enlarges your borders as he promised your ancestors and gives you all the land he pledged to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and then you are careful to observe all these commandments I am giving you today (namely, to love the Lord your God and to always walk in his ways), then you must add three more cities to these three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not shed innocent blood in your land that the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance, for that would make you guilty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, suppose a person hates someone else and stalks him, attacks him, kills him, and then flees to one of these cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The elders of his own city must send for him and remove him from there to deliver him over to the blood avenger to die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not pity him, but purge from Israel the guilt of shedding innocent blood, so that it may go well with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not encroach on your neighbor’s property, which will have been defined in the inheritance you will obtain in the land the Lord your God is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A single witness may not testify against another person for any trespass or sin that he commits. A matter may be legally established only on the testimony of two or three witnesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a false witness testifies against another person and accuses him of a crime,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then both parties to the controversy must stand before the Lord, that is, before the priests and judges who will be in office in those days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The judges will thoroughly investigate the matter, and if the witness should prove to be false and to have given false testimony against the accused,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you must do to him what he had intended to do to the accused. In this way you will purge the evil from among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rest of the people will hear and become afraid to keep doing such evil among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not show pity; the principle will be a life for a life, an eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth, a hand for a hand, and a foot for a foot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you go to war against your enemies and see chariotry and troops who outnumber you, do not be afraid of them, for the Lord your God, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt, is with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As you move forward for battle, the priest will approach and say to the soldiers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Listen, Israel! Today you are moving forward to do battle with your enemies. Do not be fainthearted. Do not fear and tremble or be terrified because of them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the Lord your God goes with you to fight on your behalf against your enemies to give you victory.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, the officers are to say to the troops, “Who among you has built a new house and not dedicated it? He may go home, lest he die in battle and someone else dedicate it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or who among you has planted a vineyard and not benefited from it? He may go home, lest he die in battle and someone else benefit from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or who among you has become engaged to a woman but has not married her? He may go home, lest he die in battle and someone else marry her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In addition, the officers are to say to the troops, “Who among you is afraid and fainthearted? He may go home so that he will not make his fellow soldier’s heart as fearful as his own.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, when the officers have finished speaking, they must appoint unit commanders to lead the troops.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you approach a city to wage war against it, offer it terms of peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If it accepts your terms and submits to you, all the people found in it will become your slaves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If it does not accept terms of peace but makes war with you, then you are to lay siege to it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God will deliver it over to you, and you must kill every single male by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, the women, little children, cattle, and anything else in the city—all its plunder—you may take for yourselves as spoil. You may take from your enemies the plunder that the Lord your God has given you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is how you are to deal with all those cities located far from you, those that do not belong to these nearby nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the cities of these peoples that the Lord your God is going to give you as an inheritance, you must not allow a single living thing to survive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead you must utterly annihilate them—the Hittites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites—just as the Lord your God has commanded you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that they cannot teach you all the abhorrent ways they worship their gods, causing you to sin against the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you besiege a city for a long time while attempting to capture it, you must not chop down its trees, for you may eat fruit from them and should not cut them down. A tree in the field is not human that you should besiege it!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, you may chop down any tree you know is not suitable for food, and you may use it to build siege works against the city that is making war with you until that city falls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a homicide victim should be found lying in a field in the land the Lord your God is giving you, and no one knows who killed him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: your elders and judges must go out and measure how far it is to the cities in the vicinity of the corpse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the elders of the city nearest to the corpse must take from the herd a heifer that has not been worked—that has never pulled with the yoke—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and bring the heifer down to a wadi with flowing water, to a valley that is neither plowed nor sown. There at the wadi they are to break the heifer’s neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Levitical priests will approach (for the Lord your God has chosen them to serve him and to pronounce blessings in his name, and to decide every judicial verdict) ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the elders of that city nearest the corpse must wash their hands over the heifer whose neck was broken in the valley.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they must proclaim, “Our hands have not spilled this blood, nor have we witnessed the crime.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not blame your people Israel whom you redeemed, O Lord, and do not hold them accountable for the bloodshed of an innocent person.” Then atonement will be made for the bloodshed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In this manner you will purge the guilt of innocent blood from among you, for you must do what is right before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you go out to do battle with your enemies and the Lord your God allows you to prevail and you take prisoners,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if you should see among them an attractive woman whom you wish to take as a wife,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you may bring her back to your house. She must shave her head, trim her nails,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: discard the clothing she was wearing when captured, and stay in your house, lamenting for her father and mother for a full month. After that you may sleep with her and become her husband and she your wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you are not pleased with her, then you must let her go where she pleases. You cannot in any case sell her; you must not take advantage of her, since you have already humiliated her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suppose a man has two wives, one whom he loves more than the other, and they both bear him sons, with the firstborn being the child of the less-loved wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the day he divides his inheritance he must not appoint as firstborn the son of the favorite wife in place of the other wife’s son who is actually the firstborn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rather, he must acknowledge the son of the less-loved wife as firstborn and give him the double portion of all he has, for that son is the beginning of his father’s procreative power—to him should go the right of the firstborn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a person has a stubborn, rebellious son who pays no attention to his father or mother, and they discipline him to no avail,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his father and mother must seize him and bring him to the elders at the gate of his city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They must declare to the elders of his city, “Our son is stubborn and rebellious and pays no attention to what we say—he is a glutton and drunkard.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the men of his city must stone him to death. In this way you will purge wickedness from among you, and all Israel will hear about it and be afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a person commits a sin punishable by death and is executed, and you hang the corpse on a tree,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his body must not remain all night on the tree; instead you must make certain you bury him that same day, for the one who is left exposed on a tree is cursed by God. You must not defile your land that the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you see your neighbor’s ox or sheep going astray, do not ignore it; you must return it without fail to your neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the owner does not live near you or you do not know who the owner is, then you must corral the animal at your house and let it stay with you until the owner looks for it; then you must return it to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall do the same to his donkey, his clothes, or anything else your neighbor has lost and you have found; you must not refuse to get involved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you see your neighbor’s donkey or ox fallen along the road, do not ignore it; instead, you must be sure to help him get the animal on its feet again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A woman must not wear men’s clothing, nor should a man dress up in women’s clothing, for anyone who does this is offensive to the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you happen to notice a bird’s nest along the road, whether in a tree or on the ground, and there are chicks or eggs with the mother bird sitting on them, you must not take the mother from the young.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must be sure to let the mother go, but you may take the young for yourself. Do this so that it may go well with you and you may have a long life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you build a new house, you must construct a guardrail around your roof to avoid being culpable in the event someone should fall from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not plant your vineyard with two kinds of seed; otherwise the entire yield, both of the seed you plant and the produce of the vineyard, will be defiled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not plow with an ox and a donkey harnessed together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not wear clothing made with wool and linen meshed together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make yourselves tassels for the four corners of the clothing you wear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suppose a man marries a woman, sleeps with her, and then rejects her,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: accusing her of impropriety and defaming her reputation by saying, “I married this woman but when I approached her for marital relations I discovered she was not a virgin!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the father and mother of the young woman must produce the evidence of virginity for the elders of the city at the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The young woman’s father must say to the elders, “I gave my daughter to this man and he has rejected her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, he has raised accusations of impropriety by saying, ‘I discovered your daughter was not a virgin,’ but this is the evidence of my daughter’s virginity!” The cloth must then be spread out before the city’s elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The elders of that city must then seize the man and punish him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will fine him 100 shekels of silver and give them to the young woman’s father, for the man who made the accusation ruined the reputation of an Israelite virgin. She will then become his wife, and he may never divorce her as long as he lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the accusation is true and the young woman was not a virgin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the men of her city must bring the young woman to the door of her father’s house and stone her to death, for she has done a disgraceful thing in Israel by behaving like a prostitute while living in her father’s house. In this way you will purge the evil from among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man is discovered in bed with a married woman, both the man lying in bed with the woman and the woman herself must die; in this way you will purge the evil from Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a virgin is engaged to a man and another man meets her in the city and goes to bed with her,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you must bring the two of them to the gate of that city and stone them to death, the young woman because she did not cry out though in the city and the man because he violated his neighbor’s fiancée; in this way you will purge evil from among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the man came across the engaged woman in the field and overpowered her and raped her, then only the rapist must die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not do anything to the young woman—she has done nothing deserving of death. This case is the same as when someone attacks another person and murders him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the man met her in the field and the engaged woman cried out, but there was no one to rescue her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suppose a man comes across a virgin who is not engaged and takes hold of her and sleeps with her and they are discovered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man who has slept with her must pay her father fifty shekels of silver and she must become his wife. Because he has humiliated her, he may never divorce her as long as he lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (23:1) A man may not marry his father’s former wife and in this way dishonor his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man with crushed or severed genitals may not enter the assembly of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A person of illegitimate birth may not enter the assembly of the Lord; to the tenth generation no one related to him may do so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No Ammonite or Moabite may enter the assembly of the Lord; to the tenth generation none of their descendants shall ever do so,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for they did not meet you with food and water on the way as you came from Egypt, and furthermore, they hired Balaam son of Beor of Pethor in Aram Naharaim to curse you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord your God refused to listen to Balaam and changed the curse to a blessing, for the Lord your God loves you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not seek peace and prosperity for them through all the ages to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not hate an Edomite, for he is your relative; you must not hate an Egyptian, for you lived as a foreigner in his land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Children of the third generation born to them may enter the assembly of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you go out as an army against your enemies, guard yourselves against anything impure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If there is someone among you who is impure because of some nocturnal emission, he must leave the camp; he may not reenter it immediately.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When evening arrives he must wash himself with water, and then at sunset he may reenter the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to have a place outside the camp to serve as a latrine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must have a spade among your other equipment, and when you relieve yourself outside you must dig a hole with the spade and then turn and cover your excrement.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord your God walks about in the middle of your camp to deliver you and defeat your enemies for you. Therefore your camp should be holy, so that he does not see anything indecent among you and turn away from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not return an escaped slave to his master when he has run away to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, he may live among you in any place he chooses, in whichever of your villages he prefers; you must not oppress him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There must never be a sacred prostitute among the young women of Israel nor a sacred male prostitute among the young men of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must never bring the pay of a female prostitute or the wage of a male prostitute into the temple of the Lord your God in fulfillment of any vow, for both of these are abhorrent to the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not charge interest on a loan to your fellow Israelite, whether on money, food, or anything else that has been loaned with interest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may lend with interest to a foreigner, but not to your fellow Israelite; if you keep this command the Lord your God will bless you in all you undertake in the land you are about to enter to possess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you make a vow to the Lord your God you must not delay in fulfilling it, for otherwise he will surely hold you accountable as a sinner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you refrain from making a vow, it will not be sinful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whatever you vow, you must be careful to do what you have promised, such as what you have vowed to the Lord your God as a freewill offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you enter the vineyard of your neighbor you may eat as many grapes as you please, but you must not take away any in a container.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you go into the ripe grain fields of your neighbor you may pluck off the kernels with your hand, but you must not use a sickle on your neighbor’s ripe grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man marries a woman and she does not please him because he has found something indecent in her, then he may draw up a divorce document, give it to her, and evict her from his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she has left him she may go and become someone else’s wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the second husband rejects her and then divorces her, gives her the papers, and evicts her from his house, or if the second husband who married her dies,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: her first husband who divorced her is not permitted to remarry her after she has become ritually impure, for that is offensive to the Lord. You must not bring guilt on the land that the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a man is newly married, he need not go into the army nor be obligated in any way; he must be free to stay at home for a full year and bring joy to the wife he has married.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One must not take either lower or upper millstones as security on a loan, for that is like taking a life itself as security.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man is found kidnapping a person from among his fellow Israelites, and regards him as mere property and sells him, that kidnapper must die. In this way you will purge the evil from among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be careful during an outbreak of leprosy to follow precisely all that the Levitical priests instruct you; as I have commanded them, so you should do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember what the Lord your God did to Miriam along the way after you left Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you make any kind of loan to your neighbor, you may not go into his house to claim what he is offering as security.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must stand outside and the person to whom you are making the loan will bring out to you what he is offering as security.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the person is poor you may not use what he gives you as security for a covering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must by all means return to him at sunset the item he gave you as security so that he may sleep in his outer garment and bless you for it; it will be considered a just deed by the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not oppress a lowly and poor servant, whether one from among your fellow Israelites or from the resident foreigners who are living in your land and villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must pay his wage that very day before the sun sets, for he is poor and his life depends on it. Otherwise he will cry out to the Lord against you, and you will be guilty of sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fathers must not be put to death for what their children do, nor children for what their fathers do; each must be put to death for his own sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not pervert justice due a resident foreigner or an orphan, or take a widow’s garment as security for a loan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember that you were slaves in Egypt and that the Lord your God redeemed you from there; therefore I am commanding you to do all this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever you reap your harvest in your field and leave some unraked grain there, you must not return to get it; it should go to the resident foreigner, orphan, and widow so that the Lord your God may bless all the work you do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you beat your olive tree you must not repeat the procedure; the remaining olives belong to the resident foreigner, orphan, and widow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you gather the grapes of your vineyard you must not do so a second time; they should go to the resident foreigner, orphan, and widow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember that you were slaves in the land of Egypt; therefore, I am commanding you to do all this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If controversy arises between people, they should go to court for judgment. When the judges hear the case, they shall exonerate the innocent but condemn the guilty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, if the guilty person is sentenced to a beating, the judge shall force him to lie down and be beaten in his presence with the number of blows his wicked behavior deserves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The judge may sentence him to forty blows, but no more. If he is struck with more than these, you might view your fellow Israelite with contempt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not muzzle your ox when it is treading grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If brothers live together and one of them dies without having a son, the dead man’s wife must not remarry someone outside the family. Instead, her late husband’s brother must go to her, marry her, and perform the duty of a brother-in-law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the first son she bears will continue the name of the dead brother, thus preventing his name from being blotted out of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the man does not want to marry his brother’s widow, then she must go to the elders at the town gate and say, “My husband’s brother refuses to preserve his brother’s name in Israel; he is unwilling to perform the duty of a brother-in-law to me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the elders of his city must summon him and speak to him. If he persists, saying, “I don’t want to marry her,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then his sister-in-law must approach him in view of the elders, remove his sandal from his foot, and spit in his face. She will then respond, “Thus may it be done to any man who does not maintain his brother’s family line!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His family name will be referred to in Israel as “the family of the one whose sandal was removed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If two men get into a hand-to-hand fight, and the wife of one of them gets involved to help her husband against his attacker, and she reaches out her hand and grabs his private parts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you must cut off her hand—do not pity her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not have in your bag different stone weights, a heavy and a light one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not have in your house different measuring containers, a large and a small one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must have an accurate and correct stone weight and an accurate and correct measuring container, so that your life may be extended in the land the Lord your God is about to give you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For anyone who acts dishonestly in these ways is abhorrent to the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember what the Amalekites did to you on your way from Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how they met you along the way and cut off all your stragglers in the rear of the march when you were exhausted and tired; they were unafraid of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when the Lord your God gives you relief from all the enemies who surround you in the land he is giving you as an inheritance, you must wipe out the memory of the Amalekites from under heaven—do not forget!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you enter the land that the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance, and you occupy it and live in it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you must take the first of all the ground’s produce you harvest from the land the Lord your God is giving you, place it in a basket, and go to the place where he chooses to locate his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must go to the priest in office at that time and say to him, “I declare today to the Lord your God that I have come into the land that the Lord promised to our ancestors to give us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest will then take the basket from you and set it before the altar of the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you must affirm before the Lord your God, “A wandering Aramean was my ancestor, and he went down to Egypt and lived there as a foreigner with a household few in number, but there he became a great, powerful, and numerous people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Egyptians mistreated and oppressed us, forcing us to do burdensome labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So we cried out to the Lord, the God of our ancestors, and he heard us and saw our humiliation, toil, and oppression.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the Lord brought us out of Egypt with tremendous strength and power, as well as with great awe-inspiring signs and wonders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he brought us to this place and gave us this land, a land flowing with milk and honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now, look! I have brought the first of the ground’s produce that you, Lord, have given me.” Then you must set it down before the Lord your God and worship before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will celebrate all the good things that the Lord your God has given you and your family, along with the Levites and the resident foreigners among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you finish tithing all your income in the third year (the year of tithing), you must give it to the Levites, the resident foreigners, the orphans, and the widows so that they may eat to their satisfaction in your villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall say before the Lord your God, “I have removed the sacred offering from my house and given it to the Levites, the resident foreigners, the orphans, and the widows just as you have commanded me. I have not violated or forgotten your commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have not eaten anything when I was in mourning, or removed any of it while ceremonially unclean, or offered any of it to the dead; I have obeyed you and have done everything you have commanded me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look down from your holy dwelling place in heaven and bless your people Israel and the land you have given us, just as you promised our ancestors—a land flowing with milk and honey.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Today the Lord your God is commanding you to keep these statutes and ordinances, something you must do with all your heart and soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Today you have declared the Lord to be your God, and that you will walk in his ways, keep his statutes, commandments, and ordinances, and obey him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And today the Lord has declared you to be his special people (as he already promised you) so you may keep all his commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he will elevate you above all the nations he has made and you will receive praise, fame, and honor. You will be a people holy to the Lord your God, as he has said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses and the elders of Israel commanded the people: “Pay attention to all the commandments I am giving you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you cross the Jordan River to the land the Lord your God is giving you, you must erect great stones and cover them with plaster.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you must inscribe on them all the words of this law when you cross over, so that you may enter the land the Lord your God is giving you, a land flowing with milk and honey just as the Lord, the God of your ancestors, said to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when you cross the Jordan you must erect on Mount Ebal these stones about which I am commanding you today, and you must cover them with plaster.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you must build an altar there to the Lord your God, an altar of stones—do not use an iron tool on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must build the altar of the Lord your God with whole stones and offer burnt offerings on it to the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also you must offer fellowship offerings and eat them there, rejoicing before the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must inscribe on the stones all the words of this law, making them clear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses and the Levitical priests spoke to all Israel: “Be quiet and pay attention, Israel. Today you have become the people of the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must obey him and keep his commandments and statutes that I am giving you today.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, Moses commanded the people that day:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The following tribes must stand to bless the people on Mount Gerizim when you cross the Jordan: Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Joseph, and Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these other tribes must stand for the curse on Mount Ebal: Reuben, Gad, Asher, Zebulun, Dan, and Naphtali.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Levites will call out to every Israelite with a loud voice:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Cursed is the one who makes a carved or metal image—something abhorrent to the Lord, the work of the craftsman—and sets it up in a secret place.’ Then all the people will say, ‘Amen!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Cursed is the one who disrespects his father and mother.’ Then all the people will say, ‘Amen!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Cursed is the one who moves his neighbor’s boundary marker.’ Then all the people will say, ‘Amen!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Cursed is the one who misleads a blind person on the road.’ Then all the people will say, ‘Amen!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Cursed is the one who perverts justice for the resident foreigner, the orphan, and the widow.’ Then all the people will say, ‘Amen!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Cursed is the one who goes to bed with his father’s former wife, for he dishonors his father.’ Then all the people will say, ‘Amen!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Cursed is the one who commits bestiality.’ Then all the people will say, ‘Amen!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Cursed is the one who goes to bed with his sister, the daughter of either his father or mother.’ Then all the people will say, ‘Amen!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Cursed is the one who goes to bed with his mother-in-law.’ Then all the people will say, ‘Amen!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Cursed is the one who kills his neighbor in private.’ Then all the people will say, ‘Amen!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Cursed is the one who takes a bribe to kill an innocent person.’ Then all the people will say, ‘Amen!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Cursed is the one who refuses to keep the words of this law.’ Then all the people will say, ‘Amen!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you indeed obey the Lord your God and are careful to observe all his commandments I am giving you today, the Lord your God will elevate you above all the nations of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these blessings will come to you in abundance if you obey the Lord your God:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be blessed in the city and blessed in the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your children will be blessed, as well as the produce of your soil, the offspring of your livestock, the calves of your herds, and the lambs of your flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your basket and your mixing bowl will be blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be blessed when you come in and blessed when you go out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will cause your enemies who attack you to be struck down before you; they will attack you from one direction but flee from you in seven different directions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will decree blessing for you with respect to your barns and in everything you do—yes, he will bless you in the land he is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will designate you as his holy people just as he promised you, if you keep his commandments and obey him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the peoples of the earth will see that you belong to the Lord, and they will respect you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will greatly multiply your children, the offspring of your livestock, and the produce of your soil in the land that he promised your ancestors he would give you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will open for you his good treasure house, the heavens, to give you rain for the land in its season and to bless all you do; you will lend to many nations but you will not borrow from any.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will make you the head and not the tail, and you will always end up at the top and not at the bottom, if you obey his commandments that I am urging you today to be careful to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you must not turn away from all the commandments I am giving you today, to either the right or left, nor pursue other gods and worship them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But if you ignore the Lord your God and are not careful to keep all his commandments and statutes I am giving you today, then all these curses will come upon you in full force:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be cursed in the city and cursed in the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your basket and your mixing bowl will be cursed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your children will be cursed, as well as the produce of your soil, the calves of your herds, and the lambs of your flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be cursed when you come in and cursed when you go out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord will send on you a curse, confusing you and opposing you in everything you undertake until you are destroyed and quickly perish because of the evil of your deeds, in that you have forsaken me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will plague you with deadly diseases until he has completely removed you from the land you are about to possess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will afflict you with weakness, fever, inflammation, infection, sword, blight, and mildew; these will attack you until you perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sky above your heads will be bronze and the earth beneath you iron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will make the rain of your land powder and dust; it will come down on you from the sky until you are destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord will allow you to be struck down before your enemies; you will attack them from one direction but flee from them in seven directions and will become an object of terror to all the kingdoms of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your carcasses will be food for every bird of the sky and wild animal of the earth, and there will be no one to chase them off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will afflict you with the boils of Egypt and with tumors, eczema, and scabies, all of which cannot be healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will also subject you to madness, blindness, and confusion of mind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will feel your way along at noon like the blind person does in darkness and you will not succeed in anything you do; you will be constantly oppressed and continually robbed, with no one to save you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be engaged to a woman, and another man will rape her. You will build a house but not live in it. You will plant a vineyard but not even begin to use it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your ox will be slaughtered before your very eyes, but you will not eat of it. Your donkey will be stolen from you as you watch and will not be returned to you. Your flock of sheep will be given to your enemies, and there will be no one to save you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your sons and daughters will be given to another people while you look on in vain all day, and you will be powerless to do anything about it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the produce of your land and all your labor, a people you do not know will consume it, and you will be nothing but oppressed and crushed for the rest of your lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will go insane from seeing all this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will afflict you in your knees and on your legs with painful, incurable boils—from the soles of your feet to the top of your head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will force you and your king whom you will appoint over you to go away to a people whom you and your ancestors have not known, and you will serve other gods of wood and stone there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will become an occasion of horror, a proverb, and an object of ridicule to all the peoples to whom the Lord will drive you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You will take much seed to the field but gather little harvest, because locusts will consume it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will plant vineyards and cultivate them, but you will not drink wine or gather in grapes, because worms will eat them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will have olive trees throughout your territory, but you will not anoint yourself with olive oil, because the olives will drop off the trees while still unripe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will bear sons and daughters but not keep them, because they will be taken into captivity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whirring locusts will take over every tree and all the produce of your soil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The resident foreigners who reside among you will become higher and higher over you, and you will become lower and lower.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will lend to you, but you will not lend to them; they will become the head, and you will become the tail!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “All these curses will fall on you, pursuing and overtaking you until you are destroyed, because you would not obey the Lord your God by keeping his commandments and statutes that he has given you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These curses will be a perpetual sign and wonder with reference to you and your descendants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Because you have not served the Lord your God joyfully and wholeheartedly with the abundance of everything you have,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: instead in hunger, thirst, nakedness, and poverty you will serve your enemies whom the Lord will send against you. They will place an iron yoke on your neck until they have destroyed you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will raise up a distant nation against you, one from the other side of the earth as the eagle flies, a nation whose language you will not understand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a nation of stern appearance that will have no regard for the elderly or pity for the young.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will devour the offspring of your livestock and the produce of your soil until you are destroyed. They will not leave you with any grain, new wine, olive oil, calves of your herds, or lambs of your flocks until they have destroyed you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will besiege all of your villages until all of your high and fortified walls collapse—those in which you put your confidence throughout the land. They will besiege all your villages throughout the land the Lord your God has given you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will then eat your own offspring, the flesh of the sons and daughters the Lord your God has given you, because of the severity of the siege by which your enemies will constrict you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man among you who is by nature tender and sensitive will turn against his brother, his beloved wife, and his remaining children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will withhold from all of them his children’s flesh that he is eating (since there is nothing else left), because of the severity of the siege by which your enemy will constrict you in your villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise, the most tender and delicate of your women, who would never think of putting even the sole of her foot on the ground because of her daintiness, will turn against her beloved husband, her sons and daughters,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and will secretly eat her afterbirth and her newborn children (since she has nothing else), because of the severity of the siege by which your enemy will constrict you in your villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you refuse to obey all the words of this law, the things written in this scroll, and refuse to fear this glorious and awesome name, the Lord your God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the Lord will increase your punishments and those of your descendants—great and long-lasting afflictions and severe, enduring illnesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will infect you with all the diseases of Egypt that you dreaded, and they will persistently afflict you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, the Lord will bring upon you every kind of sickness and plague not mentioned in this scroll of commandments, until you have perished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There will be very few of you left, though at one time you were as numerous as the stars in the sky, because you will have disobeyed the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what will happen: Just as the Lord delighted to do good for you and make you numerous, so he will also take delight in destroying and decimating you. You will be uprooted from the land you are about to possess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will scatter you among all nations, from one end of the earth to the other. There you will worship other gods that neither you nor your ancestors have known, gods of wood and stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Among those nations you will have no rest, nor will there be a place of peaceful rest for the soles of your feet, for there the Lord will give you an anxious heart, failing eyesight, and a spirit of despair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your life will hang in doubt before you; you will be terrified by night and day and will have no certainty of surviving from one day to the next.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the morning you will say, ‘If only it were evening!’ And in the evening you will say, ‘I wish it were morning!’ because of the things you will fear and the things you will see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord will make you return to Egypt by ship, over a route I said to you that you would never see again. There you will sell yourselves to your enemies as male and female slaves, but no one will buy you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (28:69) These are the words of the covenant that the Lord commanded Moses to make with the people of Israel in the land of Moab, in addition to the covenant he had made with them at Horeb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses proclaimed to all Israel as follows: “You have seen all that the Lord did in the land of Egypt to Pharaoh, all his servants, and his land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your eyes have seen the great judgments, those signs and mighty wonders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to this very day the Lord has not given you an understanding mind, perceptive eyes, or discerning ears!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have led you through the wilderness for forty years. Your clothing has not worn out nor have your sandals deteriorated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have eaten no bread and drunk no wine or beer—all so that you might know that I am the Lord your God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you came to this place King Sihon of Heshbon and King Og of Bashan came out to make war and we defeated them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then we took their land and gave it as an inheritance to Reuben, Gad, and half the tribe of Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore, keep the terms of this covenant and obey them so that you may be successful in everything you do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are standing today, all of you, before the Lord your God—the heads of your tribes, your elders, your officials, every Israelite man,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: your infants, your wives, and the resident foreigners living in your encampment, those who chop wood and those who carry water—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that you may enter by oath into the covenant the Lord your God is making with you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Today he will affirm that you are his people and that he is your God, just as he promised you and as he swore by oath to your ancestors Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is not with you alone that I am making this covenant by oath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but with whoever stands with us here today before the Lord our God as well as those not with us here today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “(For you know how we lived in the land of Egypt and how we crossed through the nations as we traveled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have seen their detestable things and idols of wood, stone, silver, and gold.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beware that the heart of no man, woman, clan, or tribe among you turns away from the Lord our God today to pursue and serve the gods of those nations; beware that there is among you no root producing poisonous and bitter fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When such a person hears the words of this oath he secretly blesses himself and says, ‘I will have peace though I continue to walk with a stubborn spirit.’ This will destroy the watered ground with the parched.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will be unwilling to forgive him, and his intense anger will rage against that man; all the curses written in this scroll will fall upon him, and the Lord will obliterate his name from memory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will single him out for judgment from all the tribes of Israel according to all the curses of the covenant written in this scroll of the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The generation to come—your descendants who will rise up after you, as well as the foreigner who will come from distant places—will see the afflictions of that land and the illnesses that the Lord has brought on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole land will be covered with brimstone, salt, and burning debris; it will not be planted nor will it sprout or produce grass. It will resemble the destruction of Sodom and Gomorrah, Admah and Zeboyim, which the Lord destroyed in his intense anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the nations will ask, ‘Why has the Lord done all this to this land? What is this fierce, heated display of anger all about?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then people will say, ‘Because they abandoned the covenant of the Lord, the God of their ancestors, which he made with them when he brought them out of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went and served other gods and worshiped them, gods they did not know and that he did not permit them to worship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That is why the Lord’s anger erupted against this land, bringing on it all the curses written in this scroll.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord has uprooted them from their land in anger, wrath, and great rage and has deported them to another land, as is clear today.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The secret things belong to the Lord our God, but those that are revealed belong to us and our descendants forever, so that we might obey all the words of this law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you have experienced all these things, both the blessings and the curses I have set before you, you will reflect upon them in all the nations where the Lord your God has banished you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then if you and your descendants turn to the Lord your God and obey him with your whole mind and being just as I am commanding you today,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Lord your God will reverse your captivity and have pity on you. He will turn and gather you from all the peoples among whom he has scattered you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even if your exiles are in the most distant land, from there the Lord your God will gather you and bring you back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he will bring you to the land your ancestors possessed and you also will possess it; he will do better for you and multiply you more than he did your ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God will also cleanse your heart, and the hearts of your descendants so that you may love him with all your mind and being and so that you may live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord your God will put all these curses on your enemies, on those who hate you and persecute you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will return and obey the Lord, keeping all his commandments I am giving you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God will make the labor of your hands abundantly successful and multiply your children, the offspring of your cattle, and the produce of your soil. For the Lord will once more rejoice over you to make you prosperous just as he rejoiced over your ancestors,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if you obey the Lord your God and keep his commandments and statutes that are written in this scroll of the law. But you must turn to him with your whole mind and being.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This commandment I am giving you today is not too difficult for you, nor is it too remote.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is not in heaven, as though one must say, ‘Who will go up to heaven to get it for us and proclaim it to us so we may obey it?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it is not across the sea, as though one must say, ‘Who will cross over to the other side of the sea and get it for us and proclaim it to us so we may obey it?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the thing is very near you—it is in your mouth and in your mind so that you can do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Look! I have set before you today life and prosperity on the one hand, and death and disaster on the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What I am commanding you today is to love the Lord your God, to walk in his ways, and to obey his commandments, his statutes, and his ordinances. Then you will live and become numerous and the Lord your God will bless you in the land that you are about to possess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, if you turn aside and do not obey, but are lured away to worship and serve other gods,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I declare to you this very day that you will certainly perish! You will not extend your time in the land you are crossing the Jordan to possess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Today I invoke heaven and earth as witnesses against you that I have set life and death, blessing and curse, before you. Therefore choose life so that you and your descendants may live!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I also call on you to love the Lord your God, to obey him and be loyal to him, for he gives you life and enables you to live continually in the land the Lord promised to give to your ancestors Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses went and spoke these words to all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Today I am 120 years old. I am no longer able to get about, and the Lord has said to me, ‘You will not cross the Jordan.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the Lord your God, he is about to cross over before you; he will destroy these nations before you, and you will dispossess them. As for Joshua, he is about to cross before you just as the Lord has said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will do to them just what he did to Sihon and Og, the Amorite kings, and to their land, which he destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will deliver them over to you, and you will do to them according to the whole commandment I have given you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be strong and courageous! Do not fear or tremble before them, for the Lord your God is the one who is going with you. He will not fail you or abandon you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses called out to Joshua in the presence of all Israel, “Be strong and courageous, for you will accompany these people to the land that the Lord promised to give their ancestors, and you will enable them to inherit it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord is indeed going before you—he will be with you; he will not fail you or abandon you. Do not be afraid or discouraged!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses wrote down this law and gave it to the Levitical priests, who carry the ark of the Lord’s covenant, and to all Israel’s elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He commanded them: “At the end of seven years, at the appointed time of the cancellation of debts, at the Feast of Shelters,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when all Israel comes to appear before the Lord your God in the place he chooses, you must read this law before them within their hearing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gather the people—men, women, and children, as well as the resident foreigners in your villages—so they may hear and thus learn about and fear the Lord your God and carefully obey all the words of this law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then their children, who have not known this law, will also hear about and learn to fear the Lord your God for as long as you live in the land you are crossing the Jordan to possess.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “The day of your death is near. Summon Joshua and present yourselves in the tent of meeting so that I can commission him.” So Moses and Joshua presented themselves in the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord appeared in the tent in a pillar of cloud that stood above the door of the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “You are about to die, and then these people will begin to prostitute themselves with the foreign gods of the land into which they are going. They will reject me and break my covenant that I have made with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time my anger will erupt against them, and I will abandon them and hide my face from them until they are devoured. Many disasters and distresses will overcome them so that they will say at that time, ‘Have not these disasters overcome us because our God is not among us ?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will certainly hide myself at that time because of all the wickedness they will have done by turning to other gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now write down for yourselves the following song and teach it to the Israelites. Put it into their very mouths so that this song may serve as my witness against the Israelites!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For after I have brought them to the land I promised to their ancestors—one flowing with milk and honey—and they eat their fill and become fat, then they will turn to other gods and worship them; they will reject me and break my covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then when many disasters and distresses overcome them this song will testify against them, for their descendants will not forget it. I know the intentions they have in mind today, even before I bring them to the land I have promised.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So on that day Moses wrote down this song and taught it to the Israelites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Lord commissioned Joshua son of Nun, “Be strong and courageous, for you will take the Israelites to the land I have promised them, and I will be with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses finished writing on a scroll the words of this law in their entirety,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he commanded the Levites who carried the ark of the Lord’s covenant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take this scroll of the law and place it beside the ark of the covenant of the Lord your God. It will remain there as a witness against you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I know about your rebellion and stubbornness. Indeed, even while I have been living among you to this very day, you have rebelled against the Lord; you will be even more rebellious after my death!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gather to me all your tribal elders and officials so I can speak to them directly about these things and call the heavens and the earth to witness against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I know that after I die you will totally corrupt yourselves and turn away from the path I have commanded you to walk. Disaster will confront you in future days because you will act wickedly before the Lord, inciting him to anger because of your actions.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses recited the words of this song from start to finish in the hearing of the whole assembly of Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen, O heavens, and I will speak;
hear, O earth, the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My teaching will drop like the rain,
my sayings will drip like the dew,
as rain drops upon the grass,
and showers upon new growth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I will proclaim the name of the Lord;
you must acknowledge the greatness of our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for the Rock, his work is perfect,
for all his ways are just.
He is a reliable God who is never unjust,
he is fair and upright.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Is this how you repay the Lord,
you foolish, unwise people?
Is he not your father, your Creator?
He has made you and established you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember the ancient days;
bear in mind the years of past generations.
Ask your father and he will inform you,
your elders, and they will tell you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the Most High gave the nations their inheritance,
when he divided up humankind,
he set the boundaries of the peoples,
according to the number of the heavenly assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord’s allotment is his people,
Jacob is his special possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord found him in a desolate land,
in an empty wasteland where animals howl.
He continually guarded him and taught him;
he continually protected him like the pupil of his eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like an eagle that stirs up its nest,
that hovers over its young,
so the Lord spread out his wings and took him,
he lifted him up on his pinions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord alone was guiding him,
no foreign god was with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He enabled him to travel over the high terrain of the land,
and he ate of the produce of the fields.
He provided honey for him from the cliffs,
and olive oil from the hardest of rocks,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
butter from the herd
and milk from the flock,
along with the fat of lambs,
rams and goats of Bashan,
along with the best of the kernels of wheat;
and from the juice of grapes you drank wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But Jeshurun became fat and kicked;
you got fat, thick, and stuffed!
Then he deserted the God who made him,
and treated the Rock who saved him with contempt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They made him jealous with other gods,
they enraged him with abhorrent idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They sacrificed to demons, not God,
to gods they had not known;
to new gods who had recently come along,
gods your ancestors had not known about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You forgot the Rock who fathered you,
and put out of mind the God who gave you birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the Lord took note and despised them
because his sons and daughters enraged him.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They have made me jealous with false gods,
enraging me with their worthless gods;
so I will make them jealous with a people they do not recognize,
with a nation slow to learn I will enrage them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For a fire has been kindled by my anger,
and it burns to lowest Sheol;
it consumes the earth and its produce,
and ignites the foundations of the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will increase their disasters;
I will use up my arrows on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will be starved by famine,
eaten by plague, and bitterly stung;
I will send the teeth of wild animals against them,
along with the poison of creatures that crawl in the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sword will make people childless outside,
and terror will do so inside;
they will destroy both the young man and the virgin,
the infant and the gray-haired man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I said, ‘I want to cut them in pieces.
I want to make people forget they ever existed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I fear the reaction of their enemies,
for their adversaries would misunderstand
and say, “Our power is great,
and the Lord has not done all this!”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are a nation devoid of wisdom,
and there is no understanding among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
