verses.text:
I wish that they were wise and could understand this,
and that they could comprehend what will happen to them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How can one man chase a thousand of them,
and two pursue ten thousand,
unless their Rock had delivered them up—
and the Lord had handed them over?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For our enemies’ rock is not like our Rock,
as even our enemies concede.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For their vine is from the stock of Sodom,
and from the fields of Gomorrah.
Their grapes contain venom;
their clusters of grapes are bitter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their wine is snakes’ poison,
the deadly venom of cobras.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Is this not stored up with me?” says the Lord,
“Is it not sealed up in my storehouses?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will judge his people,
and will change his plans concerning his servants;
when he sees that their power has disappeared,
and that no one is left, whether confined or set free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will say, “Where are their gods,
the rock in whom they sought security,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who ate the best of their sacrifices,
and drank the wine of their drink offerings?
Let them rise and help you;
let them be your refuge!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“See now that I, indeed I, am he!” says the Lord,
“and there is no other god besides me.
I kill and give life,
I smash and I heal,
and none can resist my power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I raise up my hand to heaven,
and say, ‘As surely as I live forever,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will sharpen my lightning-like sword,
and my hand will grasp hold of the weapon of judgment;
I will execute vengeance on my foes,
and repay those who hate me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will make my arrows drunk with blood,
and my sword will devour flesh—
the blood of the slaughtered and captured,
the chief of the enemy’s leaders.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cry out, O nations, with his people,
for he will avenge his servants’ blood;
he will take vengeance against his enemies,
and make atonement for his land and people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses went with Joshua son of Nun and recited all the words of this song to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses finished reciting all these words to all Israel
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he said to them, “Keep in mind all the words I am solemnly proclaiming to you today; you must command your children to observe carefully all the words of this law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is no idle word for you—it is your life! By this word you will live a long time in the land you are about to cross the Jordan to possess.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses that same day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go up to this Abarim hill country, to Mount Nebo (which is in the land of Moab opposite Jericho), and look at the land of Canaan that I am giving to the Israelites as a possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will die on the mountain that you ascend and join your deceased ancestors, just as Aaron your brother died on Mount Hor and joined his deceased ancestors,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for both of you rebelled against me among the Israelites at the waters of Meribah Kadesh in the wilderness of Zin when you did not show me proper respect among the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will see the land before you, but you will not enter the land that I am giving to the Israelites.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the blessing Moses the man of God pronounced upon the Israelites before his death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said:
“The Lord came from Sinai
and revealed himself to Israel from Seir.
He appeared in splendor from Mount Paran,
and came forth with ten thousand holy ones.
With his right hand he gave a fiery law to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely he loves the people;
all your holy ones are in your power.
And they sit at your feet,
each receiving your words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Moses delivered to us a law,
an inheritance for the assembly of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord was king over Jeshurun,
when the leaders of the people assembled,
the tribes of Israel together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“May Reuben live and not die,
and may his people multiply.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And this is the blessing to Judah. He said,
“Listen, O Lord, to Judah’s voice,
and bring him to his people.
May his power be great,
and may you help him against his foes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of Levi he said:
“Your Thummim and Urim belong to your godly one,
whose authority you challenged at Massah,
and with whom you argued at the waters of Meribah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to his father and mother, ‘I have not seen him,’
and he did not acknowledge his own brothers
or know his own children,
for they kept your word,
and guarded your covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will teach Jacob your ordinances
and Israel your law;
they will offer incense as a pleasant odor,
and a whole offering on your altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bless, O Lord, his goods,
and be pleased with his efforts;
undercut the legs of any who attack him,
and of those who hate him, so that they cannot stand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of Benjamin he said:
“The beloved of the Lord will live safely by him;
he protects him all the time,
and the Lord places him on his chest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of Joseph he said:
“May the Lord bless his land
with the harvest produced by the sky, by the dew,
and by the depths crouching beneath;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
with the harvest produced by the daylight
and by the moonlight;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
with the best of the ancient mountains
and the harvest produced by the age-old hills;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
with the harvest of the earth and its fullness
and the pleasure of him who resided in the burning bush.
May blessing rest on Joseph’s head,
and on the top of the head of the one set apart from his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the firstborn of his bull bring him honor,
and may his horns be those of a wild ox;
with them may he gore all peoples,
all the far reaches of the earth.
They are the ten thousands of Ephraim,
and they are the thousands of Manasseh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of Zebulun he said:
“Rejoice, Zebulun, when you go outside,
and Issachar, when you are in your tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Of Gad he said:
“Blessed be the one who enlarges Gad.
Like a lioness he will dwell;
he will tear at an arm—indeed, a scalp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has selected the best part for himself,
for the portion of the ruler is set aside there;
he came with the leaders of the people,
he obeyed the righteous laws of the Lord
and his ordinances with Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Of Naphtali he said:
“O Naphtali, overflowing with favor,
and full of the Lord’s blessing,
possess the west and south.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of Asher he said:
“Asher is blessed with children;
may he be favored by his brothers,
and may he dip his foot in olive oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The bars of your gates will be made of iron and bronze,
and may you have lifelong strength.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“There is no one like God, O Jeshurun,
who rides through the sky to help you,
on the clouds in majesty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The everlasting God is a refuge,
and underneath you are his eternal arms;
he has driven out enemies before you,
and has said, “Destroy!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Israel lives in safety,
the fountain of Jacob is quite secure,
in a land of grain and new wine;
indeed, its heavens rain down dew.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have joy, Israel! Who is like you?
You are a people delivered by the Lord,
your protective shield
and your exalted sword.
May your enemies cringe before you;
may you trample on their backs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses ascended from the rift valley plains of Moab to Mount Nebo, to the summit of Pisgah, which is opposite Jericho. The Lord showed him the whole land—Gilead to Dan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all of Naphtali, the land of Ephraim and Manasseh, all the land of Judah as far as the distant sea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Negev, and the plain of the Valley of Jericho, the city of date palm trees, as far as Zoar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to him, “This is the land I promised to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob when I said, ‘I will give it to your descendants.’ I have let you see it, but you will not cross over there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses, the servant of the Lord, died there in the land of Moab as the Lord had said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He buried him in the valley in the land of Moab near Beth Peor, but no one knows his exact burial place to this very day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses was 120 years old when he died, but his eye was not dull nor had his vitality departed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Israelites mourned for Moses in the rift valley plains of Moab for thirty days; then the days of mourning for Moses ended.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Joshua son of Nun was full of the spirit of wisdom, for Moses had placed his hands on him; and the Israelites listened to him and did just what the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No prophet ever again arose in Israel like Moses, who knew the Lord face to face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did all the signs and wonders the Lord had sent him to do in the land of Egypt, to Pharaoh, all his servants, and the whole land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he displayed great power and awesome might in view of all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator
